alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Posey (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 9:52AM EDT until August 02 at 11:15AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR WHITE, WESTERN GIBSON AND POSEY COUNTIES... At 852 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported roads east and southeast of New Harmony with half a foot of water. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Evansville, Princeton, Mount Vernon, Carmi, Grayville, Owensville, Norris City, Poseyville, New Harmony, Crossville, Patoka, Enfield, Cynthiana, Blairsville, New Haven, Hazleton, Mill Shoals, Griffin, Maunie and Springerton. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
